meanings.definition: With a squinting expression or manner.
meanings.sent1: She looked squintingly at the tiny print on the menu.
meanings.sent2: He read the blurry sign squintingly to make out the words.
meanings.sent3: The detective squintingly examined the suspect's alibi, trying to catch any inconsistencies.
meanings.sent4: The old man peered squintingly at the horizon, searching for any signs of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, she gazed squintingly at the bright colors painting the sky.

meanings.definition: In a manner that involves squinting.
meanings.sent1: The child stared squintingly at the bright light, trying to see what was causing the glare.
meanings.sent2: She walked squintingly through the fog, trying to navigate the unfamiliar surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The comedian imitated a squintingly confused expression, making the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The cat watched squintingly as the mouse scurried across the room, ready to pounce at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The hiker climbed squintingly up the steep trail, shielding his eyes from the glaring sun.
